content.statement: aku-001-prime-number-definition is a fundamental concept in Science Math Number-Theory Primes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aku-001-prime-number-definition helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aku-001-prime-number-definition include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aku-001-prime-number-definition.

definitions_glossary.divisor: A number that divides another number evenly without remainder
definitions_glossary.composite_number: A natural number greater than 1 that is not prime; has more than two divisors
definitions_glossary.factor: A divisor of a number; numbers that multiply together to give the original number
definitions_glossary.coprime: Two numbers are coprime if their only common divisor is 1

properties: Every natural number > 1 has a unique prime factorization
The density of primes decreases as numbers grow larger
No formula generates all primes exclusively
Prime gaps can be arbitrarily large

tests.name: trial_division
tests.description: Test divisibility by all numbers up to √n

tests.name: miller_rabin
tests.description: Probabilistic primality test, accurate with high probability

definition.@value: A natural number greater than 1 that has exactly two distinct positive divisors: 1 and itself

prerequisites.title: Natural Numbers
prerequisites.reason: Must understand natural numbers to define primes

prerequisites.title: Division and Divisibility
prerequisites.reason: Primes are defined by their divisibility properties

enables.title: Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
enables.reason: Primes are the basis for unique factorization

enables.title: RSA Cryptography
enables.reason: RSA security relies on difficulty of factoring products of large primes

enables.title: Distribution of Primes
enables.reason: Understanding primes enables study of their distribution

related.relationship: Composite numbers are non-prime natural numbers > 1
Every composite number can be uniquely factored into primes
Algorithms exist to efficiently test primality

skos:related.skos:note: Complement to prime numbers in natural numbers > 1

learning_objectives: Distinguish between prime and composite numbers
Identify the first several prime numbers
Understand why 1 is not considered prime
Recognize primes as multiplicative building blocks
common_errors: Thinking 2 is not prime because it's even
Believing there's a largest prime number
teaching_tips: Use visual representations like factor trees
